column3: str
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? I-I thought you had returned to the Source! Heavens forbid something went awry with the spell!?
...All is well, then? I am relieved to hear that.
Oh, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. What brings you back to the First? Another adventure, mayhap?
If you've come to speak with Y'shtola, she has already left to assist Urianger.
Have no fear, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, we will see to it the white auracite is made ready in due course.

Ah, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Found your hands idle in the Source, did you? Sadly, I have nothing I can ask of you here either. But know that we are doing all we can to see the Scions returned home safely.
What would you like to do?
Ask about recent developments.
Show him your wind-up G'raha.
Call him G'raha Tia.
Nothing.

As to be expected, the recent changes in Norvrandt were invariably accompanied by some disarray. But the people have embraced the night with joy in their hearts, and they go about rebuilding their lives with optimism.
Your fellow Scions have each returned whence it all began for them, to lend a helping hand during this period of transition.
Alphinaud is in Eulmore, Alisaie at the Inn at Journey's Head, and Y'shtola with the Night's Blessed.
Thancred and Ryne, meanwhile, continue their investigation in the Empty.
Thancred and Ryne continue to be guests of the Crystarium, though of late they are often afield on some matter or other.
I had instructions to summon everyone hither should you return, but busy as they all appear to be, perhaps the reunion can wait a little while.
Rest assured I continue searching for a way to deliver your comrades home. So please, take your ease and enjoy some time to yourself.
The people of Norvrandt have embraced the night with tremendous enthusiasm. One might even say it is the coming of a new age.
Eulmore is well on its way to reformation, and Beq Lugg tells me the treatment of patients at the Inn at Journey's Head is coming along quite nicely.
Such strides in so short a time would have been impossible if not for you and the others.
All the more reason I would give them─as Beq Lugg might say─their own fitting payment. We <Emphasis>will</Emphasis> get them home, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I swear it.
Wh-What in the world is this?
A gift from Tataru, you say? A mammet inspired by a certain Archon, created to fund the expedition to the Syrcus Trench...
Passing strange... I never had the pleasure of meeting Tataru. That being the case, I can only assume the idea for the subject matter came from another.
Could it have been Master Galuf? Or Krile, perhaps? No, wait─Rammbroes! It must be Rammbroes!
Behind his somber countenance there hides a playful streak. I can fair see him grinning as he imagines how I would react should I stumble into this mammet some time in the future...
If truth be told, I know not how to feel when I behold it. But if nothing else, it tells me that they are well. Rammbroes and everyone. And for that I am glad.
...I see. If truth be told, I know not how to feel when I behold it.
Please, put it away. It is...more than I can take right now.
How strangely that name rings to the ears... Long as I have been the Crystal Exarch, it has ceased to be an act. This is very much who I am now.
Yet when you speak to me as the young man I once was, he cannot help but stir within.
And then the old days come flooding back. The days when we sought the truth of this tower together...
You were an inspiration to me then. Though I did not think it possible, you have become even more of an inspiration to me now.
